cat.uab.senda.adtn.comm

Class Comm

  • java.lang.Object
    • cat.uab.senda.adtn.comm.Comm

  • public class Comm
extends Object
    This class is a java interface for the active DTN platform This class describes the methods for create, bind, close, send and receive a bundle over the aDTN platform.
    Version:
    0.3

      Delete Bundle if Block can't be processed.

    • Method Detail

      • adtnSocket

        public static int adtnSocket()
                      throws SocketException,
                             FileNotFoundException,
                             ParseException
        Creates a socket over the aDTN platform. This method will return a socket identifier, this socket will be created with the default configuration parameters (this parameters are in the path of the aDTN platform installation).

        If the platform is not active or an error occurred in the creation an exception is generated.

        Returns:
        the socket identifier.
        Throws:
        SocketException - If cannot allocate the new socket.
        FileNotFoundException - The global configuration is missing in the file or the configuration file cannot be found.
        ParseException - The data field is missing in the configuration file.

      • adtnSocket

        public static int adtnSocket(String dataPath)
                      throws SocketException,
                             FileNotFoundException,
                             ParseException
        Creates a socket over the aDTN platform. This method will return a socket identifier, this socket will be created with the parameters in the file pointed by dataPath.

        If the platform is not active or an error occurred in the creation an exception is generated.

        Parameters:
        dataPath - path to the parameter file.
        Returns:
        the socket identifier.
        Throws:
        SocketException - If cannot allocate the new socket.
        FileNotFoundException - The global configuration is missing in the file or the configuration file cannot be found.
        ParseException - The data field is missing in the configuration file.

      • adtnBind

        public static void adtnBind(int s,
                            SockAddrT addr)
                     throws SocketException,
                            FileNotFoundException,
                            IllegalAccessException,
                            AddressInUseException
        Binds a socket to an address. This method binds a socket identifier with an address defined by SockAddrT.

        If the platform is not active or an error occurred in the creation an exception is generated.

        Parameters:
        s - the socket identifier.
        addr - the information to bind.
        Throws:
        SocketException - The socket identifier is not valid.
        FileNotFoundException - Cannot find the Bundle Agent, check if it's running.
        IllegalAccessException - The application hasn't enough permissions to bind the socket.
        AddressInUseException - The address is already in use.

      • adtnClose

        public static void adtnClose(int s)
                      throws SocketException,
                             IllegalAccessException
        Close the socket. This method closes the socket s freeing all the memory associated to the socket, the structures created at calling adtnBind are deleted to.

        If the platform is not active or an error occurred in the creation an exception is generated.

        Parameters:
        s - the socket identifier.
        Throws:
        SocketException - The socket identifier is not valid.
        IllegalAccessException - The application hasn't enough permissions to eliminate the socket.

      • adtnShutdown

        public static void adtnShutdown(int s)
                         throws SocketException,
                                FileNotFoundException,
                                IllegalAccessException
        Close the socket, also deletes waiting data. This method is similar to adtnClose(int s), adding the deletion of waiting bundles in the queue.

        If the platform is not active or an error occurred in the creation an exception is generated.

        Parameters:
        s - the socket identifier.
        Throws:
        SocketException - The socket identifier is not valid.
        FileNotFoundException - Cannot find the aDTN service, check if it's running.
        IllegalAccessException - The application hasn't enough permissions to eliminate the socket.

      • adtnSetCodeOption

        public static void adtnSetCodeOption(int s,
                                     int codeOption,
                                     String code)
                              throws SocketException,
                                     InvalidArgumentException,
                                     CodeBindException
        Sets the codes to execute. This method lets to set the code for the codeOption, the code has to be write in C.

        If the platform is not active or an error occurred in the creation an exception is generated.

        Parameters:
        s - the socket identifier.
        codeOption - the code option wanted to set (ROUTING_CODE, PRIO_CODE, LIFE_CODE).
        code - the string containing the source in C to set.
        Throws:
        SocketException - The socket identifier is not valid.
        InvalidArgumentException - Invalid code, check if code it's a valid C code.
        CodeBindException - A code is already binded to this option.

      • adtnSetCodeOption

        public static void adtnSetCodeOption(int s,
                                     int codeOption,
                                     String code,
                                     int fromFile)
                              throws SocketException,
                                     InvalidArgumentException,
                                     CodeBindException
        Sets the codes to execute. This method is similar to adtnSetCodeOption(int s, int codeOption, String code), letting the use of a file or the code in the string.

        If the platform is not active or an error occurred in the creation an exception is generated.

        Parameters:
        s - the socket identifier.
        codeOption - the code option wanted to set (ROUTING_CODE, PRIO_CODE, LIFE_CODE).
        code - the string containing the source in C to set or the path to the file with the source in C.
        fromFile - select if the code is in the file 1 or in the string 0.
        Throws:
        SocketException - The socket identifier is not valid.
        InvalidArgumentException - Invalid code, check if code it's a valid C code or a valid file.
        CodeBindException - A code is already binded to this option.

      • adtnSetCodeOption

        public static void adtnSetCodeOption(int s,
                                     int codeOption,
                                     String code,
                                     int fromFile,
                                     int replace)
                              throws SocketException,
                                     InvalidArgumentException,
                                     CodeBindException
        Sets the codes to execute. This method is similar to adtnSetCodeOption(int s, int codeOption, String code), letting the use of a file or the code in the string and the option of replace old codes.

        If the platform is not active or an error occurred in the creation an exception is generated.

        Parameters:
        s - the socket identifier.
        codeOption - the code option wanted to set (ROUTING_CODE, PRIO_CODE, LIFE_CODE).
        code - the string containing the source in C to set or the path to the file with the source in C.
        fromFile - select if the code is in the file 1 or in the string 0.
        replace - if value is 1 replace any existing code, else if value is 0 and an exists a code the function fails.
        Throws:
        SocketException - The socket identifier is not valid.
        InvalidArgumentException - Invalid code, check if code it's a valid C code or a valid file.
        CodeBindException - A code is already binded to this option.

      • adtnRemoveCodeOption

        public static void adtnRemoveCodeOption(int s,
                                        int codeOption)
                                 throws SocketException,
                                        InvalidArgumentException
        Remove the codes associated. This method removes the code codeOption setting again the default code.

        If the platform is not active or an error occurred in the creation an exception is generated.

        Parameters:
        s - the socket identifier.
        codeOption - the code option wanted to set (ROUTING_CODE, PRIO_CODE, LIFE_CODE).
        Throws:
        SocketException - The socket identifier is not valid.
        InvalidArgumentException - The codeOption is not valid.

      • adtnSetSocketOption

        public static void adtnSetSocketOption(int s,
                                       int optionCode,
                                       Object value)
                                throws SocketException,
                                       OpNotSuportedException,
                                       JNIException
        Sets an option to the new bundles generated. This method allows to set options to the new bundles generated.

        This options are:

        • OP_PROC_FLAGS: sets the primary block flags, the value must be an Integer combination of the primary block tags:
          • H_FRAG
          • H_ADMR
          • H_NOTF
          • H_CSTR
          • H_DESS
          • H_ACKR
          • H_COS_BULK
          • H_COS_NORM
          • H_COS_EXP
          • H_SR_BREC
          • H_SR_CACC
          • H_SR_BFRW
          • H_SR_BDEL
          • H_SR_BDLT
        • OP_LIFETIME: an Long value that hold the lifetime for the new bundles.
        • OP_BLOCK_FLAGS: sets the extension block flags, the value must be an Integer combination of the extension block tags:
          • B_REP_FR
          • B_ERR_NP
          • B_DEL_NP
          • B_LAST
          • B_DIS_NP
          • B_WFW_NP
          • B_EID_RE
        • OP_DEST: a SockAddrT with the destination for the bundle.
        • OP_SOURCE: a SockAddrT with the source for the bundle.
        • OP_REPORT: a SockAddrT with the report for the bundle.
        • OP_CUSTOM: a SockAddrT with the custom for the bundle.

        If the platform is not active or an error occurred in the creation an exception is generated.

        Parameters:
        s - the socket identifier.
        optionCode - the option code, as seen over.
        value - the value to set.
        Throws:
        SocketException - The socket identifier is not valid.
        OpNotSuportedException - The optionCode is not a valid option.
        JNIException - An error has occurred in the jni call.

      • adtnGetSocketOption

        public static Object adtnGetSocketOption(int s,
                                         int optionCode)
                                  throws SocketException,
                                         OpNotSuportedException,
                                         JNIException
        Gets the value of an option. This method allows to get the value of the options to the new bundles generated.

        This options are:

        • OP_PROC_FLAGS: gets the primary block flags, the function returns an Integer.
        • OP_LIFETIME: gets the lifetime, the function returns an Integer.
        • OP_BLOCK_FLAGS: gets the extension block flags, the function returns an Integer.
        • OP_DEST: gets the destination, the function returns a SockAddrT.
        • OP_SOURCE: gets the source, the function returns a SockAddrT.
        • OP_REPORT: gets the report, the function returns a SockAddrT.
        • OP_CUSTOM: gets the custom, the function returns a SockAddrT.
        • OP_LAST_TIMESTAMP: gets the timestamp of the last sended bundle, the function returns a Long

        If the platform is not active or an error occurred in the creation an exception is generated.

        Parameters:
        s - the socket identifier.
        optionCode - the option code, as seen over.
        Returns:
        the value of the option.
        Throws:
        SocketException - The socket identifier is not valid.
        OpNotSuportedException - The optionCode is not a valid option.
        JNIException - An error has occurred in the jni call.

      • adtnSendTo

        public static int adtnSendTo(int s,
                             SockAddrT addr,
                             byte[] data)
                      throws InvalidArgumentException,
                             SocketException,
                             FileNotFoundException,
                             MessageSizeException
        Sends a bundle to the addr with the information in data. This method allows to generate a bundle with the information in data and send it to the source addr.

        If the platform is not active or an error occurred in the creation an exception is generated.

        Parameters:
        s - the socket identifier.
        addr - the source SockAddrT.
        data - the information to send.
        Returns:
        a number bigger than 0 if the bundle have been send.
        Throws:
        SocketException - The socket identifier is not valid.
        InvalidArgumentException - Invalid address or empty data.
        FileNotFoundException - Cannot find the aDTN service, check if it's running.
        MessageSizeException - The data array is too big. The max size of a bundle is 6291456 bytes.

      • adtnRecv

        public static int adtnRecv(int s,
                           byte[] data,
                           int data_len)
                    throws InvalidArgumentException,
                           SocketException,
                           FileNotFoundException
        Recive a bundle and get it's data. This method allows to put the application to listening. If no message has been received this method will block until some message arrives.

        If the platform is not active or an error occurred in the creation an exception is generated.

        Parameters:
        s - the socket identifier.
        data - the array of data to fill.
        data_len - the number of bytes that will be written in data.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes received or -1 if fails.
        Throws:
        SocketException - The socket identifier is not valid.
        FileNotFoundException - Cannot find the aDTN service, check if it's running.
        InvalidArgumentException - Invalid data_len.

      • adtnRecvFrom

        public static int adtnRecvFrom(int s,
                               byte[] data,
                               int data_len,
                               SockAddrT addr)
                        throws InvalidArgumentException,
                               SocketException,
                               FileNotFoundException
        Receive a bundle and get it's data. This method is similar to adtnRecv(int s, byte[] data, int data_len), adding the extraction of the sender information.

        If the platform is not active or an error occurred in the creation an exception is generated.

        Parameters:
        s - the socket identifier.
        data - the array of data to fill.
        data_len - the number of bytes that will be written in data.
        addr - the SockAddrT to fill with the source information.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes received or -1 if fails.
        Throws:
        SocketException - The socket identifier is not valid.
        FileNotFoundException - Cannot find the aDTN service, check if it's running.
        InvalidArgumentException - Invalid data_len.
